title: Soaring growth of Ethereum layer-2 networks set to continue in 2023 - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum layer-2 networks have seen explosive growth, with daily active users and fees increasing significantly. Polygon leads the pack with 313,457 daily active users and nearly $55,000 in daily fees, followed by Optimism with 190% growth in daily active users and $119,475 in daily fees. Arbitrum One has 41,694 daily active users and $40,000 in daily fees. L2 ecosystem analytics platform L2beat reports that Arbitrum has a market share of 52% in terms of total value locked (TVL) and has seen a 9% increase in TVL over the past week. Optimism has a TVL of $1.46 billion and a market share of 30%. The two networks together account for over 80% of all collateral locked in layer-2 platforms. title: Top Crypto Analyst Highlights Area of Interest for Ethereum Traders, Breaks Down BTC and Two Booming Altcoins - The Daily Hodl
summary: Top crypto analyst highlights area of interest for Ethereum traders, breaks down BTC and two booming altcoins. Michaël van de Poppe sees "massive opportunities" for ETH traders in the coming days, with a price target of $1,460. He also highlights the $21,100-$21,300 price zone for BTC and suggests buying dips in LTC. Van de Poppe also mentions FET, an AI altcoin that has exploded in recent months, with a target price of $0.16 or $0.19-$0.20.

title: EY and Polygon update source code for blockchain - ERP Today
summary: EY and Polygon have updated the public domain source code for Nightfall, a privacy-focused blockchain solution, to enable the development of enterprise blockchain solutions. The updated version includes decentralized deployment and identification requirements to prevent control and anonymous usage. Nightfall will remain in the public domain to facilitate adoption among companies seeking to enter Ethereum and conduct business on the network. EY global blockchain leader Paul Brody and Polygon co-founder Antoni Martin highlighted the significance of this update in scaling the Ethereum ecosystem and opening up new use cases for enterprises in Web3.

title: Crypto prices today: Bitcoin, Ethereum in the red, meme coins drop - India Today
summary: Crypto prices today saw a decline, with Bitcoin and Ethereum falling by 2.15% and 3.37%, respectively. The global crypto market cap also decreased by 2.64% to $969.93B. Other notable losers included Monero, Solana, and Dash, which dropped by 7.56%, 6.34%, and 3.84%, respectively. Meme coins like Shiba Inu and Dogecoin also saw a decline, with Shiba Inu falling by 10.20% and Dogecoin by 6.10%. Metaverse tokens like Decentraland and The Sandbox also saw a decline in value, with Decentraland falling by 4.85% and The Sandbox by 4.47%.

title: National Australia Bank to Launch Stablecoin on Ethereum, Algorand: Report - Decrypt
summary: National Australia Bank (NAB) is launching a stablecoin called AUDN on Ethereum and Algorand later this year. The stablecoin will allow customers to settle transactions on the blockchain in real-time using Australian dollars. This is the second major Australian bank to launch a stablecoin, after ANZ minted its own last year. The stablecoin could be used for carbon credit trading, cross-border payments, and repurchase agreements. Australia is also moving ahead with a central bank digital currency (CBDC) project and updating its regulatory framework to adapt to crypto. However, crypto projects in Australia have faced challenges, including a failed attempt to cooperate on a single industry-wide stablecoin and the delisting of two crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs).

title: Polygon, Cosmos and Two Ethereum Rivals Have Surged Over 400% in One Metric, Says Crypto Firm - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Four blockchain projects, including two Ethereum rivals, have seen a massive surge in developer activity over the past five years, according to a new report from Electric Capital. The projects, Polygon (MATIC), Cosmos (ATOM), Solana (SOL), and Polkadot (DOT), have seen their number of monthly active developers increase by over 400% since 2018. This growth is seen as a positive indicator for the price of these cryptocurrencies. The report notes that developers are a leading indicator of value creation, as they build apps that deliver value to users, attracting more customers and developers in turn. However, the report also notes that this growth may be an undercount, as it only tracks open-source code and does not include designers, community mods, or project managers.

title: L'Oréal’s NYX Makeup Brand to Launch DAO, Ethereum NFTs to ‘Redefine Beauty’ - Decrypt
summary: L'Oréal's NYX makeup brand is launching a DAO (decentralized autonomous organization) called GORJS, which will operate on the Ethereum blockchain. The DAO will be home to 1,000 NFTs called the "FKWME Pass," which will grant holders access to exclusive benefits and the ability to participate in the governance of the organization. The DAO will be used to fund projects and initiatives that support digital creators and artists, with a focus on diversity, inclusivity, and accessibility. The move represents a shift away from traditional beauty influencer content and towards a more digital and decentralized approach to creativity and community-building.

title: SSV DAO Starts $50M Fund to Push Ethereum's Decentralization Plan - Yahoo Movies UK
summary: SSV DAO launches $50M fund to support decentralization of Ethereum's validator infrastructure. The fund is led by SSV and Digital Currency Group (DCG) and aims to mature Distributed Validator Technology (DVT) infrastructure. The fund follows a $10M grant pool launched in July to support DVT projects using the SSV protocol. High-performing grant recipients will be considered for the new ecosystem fund. This initiative is seen as crucial for Ethereum's decentralization as the current validator infrastructure is concentrated among a few major actors. Other companies, such as Obol Labs, have also raised funds to support DVT development.

title: This country launches stablecoin on Ethereum and Algorand… Details inside - AMBCrypto News
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Australia's National Australia Bank (NAB) has launched a stablecoin called AUDN on Ethereum and Algorand blockchains. The stablecoin is fully backed by Australian fiat money and aims to facilitate real-time transactions and carbon credit trading. This move highlights the growing role of banks in driving crypto innovation. NAB plans to launch the stablecoin by mid-2023, and the Australian government is still mulling over stablecoin regulation.

title: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) DAO Proposes 10,000 ETH Auction To Diversify Treasury - Ethereum World News
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) proposes selling 10,000 ETH worth $13M via Gnosis auction to diversify treasury and hedge against market downturns. Current treasury holds $2.4M in stablecoin and 40,000 ETH. Proposal aims to secure liquidity for 24 months, as ENS primary revenue is in Ether. 2.8M domains registered on ENS in 2022, despite crypto price volatility.

title: National Australia Bank to Launch Stablecoin on Ethereum, Algorand: Report - CryptoPotato
summary: National Australia Bank (NAB) is launching a stablecoin called AUDN on Ethereum and Algorand blockchain networks. The stablecoin is pegged to the Australian dollar and will enable real-time transactions, carbon credit trading, cross-border money transfers, and repurchase agreements. NAB will hold the Australian fiat-backed stablecoin. This is the second major bank in Australia to launch a stablecoin, following ANZ's launch last year. The development comes as other countries, such as Russia and Iran, are exploring the launch of stablecoins.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin slides below 21,000, Ethereum and other tokens fall - CNBCTV18
summary: Bitcoin fell 2.3% to $20,742.1, with a market value of $399.9 billion and a trade volume of nearly $30.1 billion. Ethereum dropped 3.5% to $1,523.9, with a market capitalization of $186.2 billion and a trade volume of $10.4 billion. Other cryptocurrencies such as Dogecoin, Shiba Inu, and Solana also saw significant declines, with Dogecoin slumping 7% and Shiba Inu falling 7.8%.

title: 3 Cryptocurrencies to Buy in Any Bear Market - The Motley Fool
summary: The article discusses three cryptocurrencies that could be good investments during a bear market: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Cardano. These cryptocurrencies have shown resilience and diversification benefits, with strong track records of bouncing back from market declines and accelerating global adoption. Bitcoin has the highest market capitalization and has demonstrated strong performance over the long term, while Ethereum has upgraded to a faster and more efficient proof-of-stake blockchain and leads in important niches such as NFTs, DeFi, and the metaverse. Cardano has a large developer community and a peer-reviewed approach to blockchain development, making it a stable and developing blockchain. The article concludes that these cryptocurrencies could be good options for investors looking for relatively safe and stable investments in the long term.

title: Intmax Named One of Switzerland Crypto Valley's TOP 50 Blockchain Projects for 2022 - GlobeNewswire
summary: Intmax, a zkRollUp project developed by Ryodan Systems AG, has been named one of the top 50 blockchain projects in Switzerland's Crypto Valley for 2022. The project was selected based on market valuation, funding, and the number of employees, and is expected to be the first Ethereum Layer 2 to achieve both scalability and privacy. Intmax has received a grant from the Ethereum Foundation and has been recognized as one of the best performing blockchain projects in Crypto Valley by CV VC and Bank Frick. The project's head and co-founder, Leona Hioki, believes that Intmax's ranking is a testament to the passion and dedication of the Intmax community. Ryodan Systems AG is a Switzerland-based company that develops Intmax and is committed to building and using new social infrastructures based on Ethereum cryptography.

title: Flashbots Seeks to Raise $50M at $1B Valuation: Report - Crypto Briefing
summary: Flashbots, a leading MEV organization, is seeking to raise $30-50M at a $1B valuation through a reverse-pitching process. Despite recent controversy over censoring Tornado Cash transactions, the company is looking to expand its business model. Paradigm, a crypto investment fund, is leading the investment round.

title: Machine learning algorithm sets Ethereum price for February 1, 2023 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Machine learning algorithm predicts Ethereum price to reach $1,582 on February 1, 2023, based on technical analysis indicators and web3 development activity. Ethereum is currently trading at $1,535, with a 3% increase predicted by the end of the month. The number of smart contracts deployed on the Ethereum mainnet has increased by 293% in Q4 2022, reaching peak levels despite the collapse of FTX. The Ethereum network will undergo an upgrade in March 2023, which could make it faster and more cost-effective for usage.

title: Ethereum Code Review 2023 - (Scam or Legit) Crypto Trading Platform - Outlook India
summary: Ethereum Code is a legitimate crypto trading platform for 2023, with auto-trading capabilities and a user-friendly interface. It allows for high-speed repetitive trade execution and securely stores trading profits in a digital wallet. The platform uses SSL encryption and blockchain technology to protect users' financial data from scams, hackers, and cyber theft. It also enables trading of ETH and other financial assets with fiat currencies.

title: Crypto adoption rose sharply over entire 2022 despite crashing markets - Report - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary: Despite a challenging year for the cryptocurrency market in 2022, the adoption of crypto assets continued to increase, with a 39% growth in global crypto owners, from 306 million in January to 425 million in December. Ethereum saw the most significant growth, with a 263% increase in the number of holders, from 24 million to 87 million, accounting for 20% of global crypto owners. The anticipation and execution of The Merge, as well as interest from institutional investors, momentum of NFTs, and popularity of ETH liquid staking, contributed to Ethereum's high adoption rate. Bitcoin also recorded an increase in the number of owners, growing by 20%, as it accounted for more than half (52%) of global crypto owners. However, both Ethereum and Bitcoin prices had a tough year, with ETH dropping over 68% and BTC 65% during 2022. At press time, ETH was down 4.08% on the day,
